articles.headline: 2 Billionaires Make Offer for Tribune
articles.snippet: Ronald W. Burkle and Eli Broad made a last-minute bid, topping an offer from Sam Zell by a dollar a share.
articles.abstract: Ronald W. Burkle and Eli Broad made a last-minute bid, topping an offer from Sam Zell by a dollar a share.
articles.lead_paragraph: The drama for control of the Tribune Company intensified last night as two Los Angeles billionaires put in a last-minute bid, topping an offer from the Chicago real estate magnate, Sam Zell, by a dollar a share.

articles.headline: Dell Reports It Has Found ‘Misconduct’
articles.snippet: Dell said “evidence of misconduct” had been uncovered in an internal investigation of its financial practices over several years.
articles.abstract: Dell said “evidence of misconduct” had been uncovered in an internal investigation of its financial practices over several years.
articles.lead_paragraph: With its accounting under scrutiny by federal regulators and prosecutors, Dell said yesterday that “evidence of misconduct” had been uncovered in an internal investigation of its financial practices over several years.

articles.headline: Iraqi Widow Saves Her Home, but Victory Is Brief
articles.snippet: The final hours of Suaada Saadoun’s life reveal the fierce pressure Sunnis face from Shiite militias in Baghdad.
articles.abstract: The final hours of Suaada Saadoun’s life reveal the fierce pressure Sunnis face from Shiite militias in Baghdad.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, March 29 — The two men showed up on Tuesday afternoon to evict Suaada Saadoun’s family. One was carrying a shiny black pistol.

articles.headline: Giuliani Testified He Was Briefed on Kerik in ’00
articles.snippet: As he debated Bernard B. Kerik’s promotion to police commissioner, the mayor most likely had been told of Mr. Kerik’s entanglement with a company suspected of ties to organized crime.
articles.abstract: As he debated Bernard B. Kerik’s promotion to police commissioner, the mayor most likely had been told of Mr. Kerik’s entanglement with a company suspected of ties to organized crime.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rudolph W. Giuliani told a grand jury that his former chief investigator remembered having briefed him on some aspects of Bernard B. Kerik’s relationship with a company suspected of ties to organized crime before Mr. Kerik’s appointment as New York City police commissioner, according to court records.

articles.headline: Honda Wants to Be Known for Safety
articles.snippet: The carmaker’s campaign is showing results, with some of the auto industry’s best scores on  crash tests.
articles.abstract: The carmaker’s campaign is showing results, with some of the auto industry’s best scores on  crash tests.
articles.lead_paragraph: MARYSVILLE, Ohio — From the time it started selling cars in the United States 35 years ago, Honda has fostered a reputation for building fuel-efficient vehicles.

articles.headline: Uncle Ben, Board Chairman
articles.snippet: The racially charged symbol for Uncle Ben’s rice products is taking center stage in a new campaign that makes him chairman of the company.
articles.abstract: The racially charged symbol for Uncle Ben’s rice products is taking center stage in a new campaign that makes him chairman of the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: A racially charged advertising character, who for decades has been relegated to a minor role in the marketing of the products that still carry his name, is taking center stage in a campaign that gives him a makeover — Madison Avenue style — by promoting him to chairman of the company.

articles.headline: Tensions Over French Identity Shape Voter Drives
articles.snippet: France’s presidential campaign has been seized by a subject dear to the extreme right: how best to be French.
articles.abstract: France’s presidential campaign has been seized by a subject dear to the extreme right: how best to be French.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS, March 29 — France’s presidential campaign has been seized by a subject long monopolized by the extreme right: how best to be French.

articles.headline: Drivers Shrug as Gasoline Prices Soar
articles.snippet: Prices are rising at the pumps again, but even as gas tops $3 a gallon, consumption has not gone down.
articles.abstract: Prices are rising at the pumps again, but even as gas tops $3 a gallon, consumption has not gone down.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON, March 29 — Prices at the pump are rising again, much as they do every spring as oil traders bid up the price of crude ahead of possible summer shortages. Possibilities for more conflict in Iran and elsewhere in the Middle East are adding to the surge.
